intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius hortense, commonly known as the garden hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing bright yellow to orange hues. The plant is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
